properties.headline: Woman's shop breaks Afghan mould
properties.summary: Women find it difficult to break into the jobs market in Afghanistan but in Mazar-e- Sharif one woman has defied men's hostility to become the city's only female shop-owner.

properties.headline: Operation targets Taliban heartland
properties.summary: As the US launches a major offensive in Helmand where the Taliban insurgency is at its fiercest, the BBC's Caroline Wyatt assess the tactics and dangers involved in such an operation.

properties.headline: US opens 'major Afghan offensive'
properties.summary: The US army says it has launched a major offensive against the Taliban in south Afghanistan's Helmand province.

properties.headline: Two UK soldiers die in explosion
properties.summary: Two British soldiers have been killed in an explosion in Helmand province, in southern Afghanistan.

properties.headline: Afghan rebels capture US soldier
properties.summary: A US soldier has been captured by militants in eastern Afghanistan, the US military has said.

properties.headline: US sees 'fierce' Afghan fighting
properties.summary: US forces launching a major offensive in the Afghan province of Helmand say that they have encountered fierce Taliban resistance.

properties.headline: UK forces launch Taliban assault
properties.summary: More than 700 UK troops have launched a major offensive against insurgent strongholds in southern Afghanistan.

properties.headline: Dutch 'success' in Afghan conflict
properties.summary: Parked on the tarmac at Kabul airport was the gleaming, freshly-painted Antonov plane. We climbed aboard the first ever commercial flight to Uruzgan.

properties.headline: US soldiers killed in Afghanistan
properties.summary: Two US soldiers have been killed in an attack on a military base in the eastern Afghan province of Paktika.

properties.headline: High-stakes battle' for Helmand
properties.summary: The most ambitious combat campaign in Helmand since British troops were first deployed to this southern province.

properties.headline: UK forces 'encounter few Taliban'
properties.summary: British forces on a major operation in Afghanistan say they have encountered little resistance from the Taliban.

properties.headline: Two UK soldiers die in Helmand
properties.summary: Two British soldiers have been killed in separate attacks in Afghanistan, the Ministry of Defence has said.

properties.headline: UK soldier killed in Afghan blast
properties.summary: A soldier from the 1st Battalion Welsh Guards has been killed in an explosion in southern Afghanistan, the Ministry of Defence has said.

properties.headline: Afghan car bomb attack near base
properties.summary: At least two people have been killed and many others wounded in a suicide bombing near a major Nato base in southern Afghanistan, officials say.

properties.headline: US troops killed in Afghan blast
properties.summary: The US military says six of its troops have been killed in two separate bomb blasts in Afghanistan, amid a spate of insurgent activity across the country.

properties.headline: UK soldier killed in Afghan crash
properties.summary: A British soldier has been killed in a helicopter accident in Afghanistan, the Ministry of Defence has said.

properties.headline: Taliban infiltrate once-peaceful Afghan north
properties.summary: A recent spate of attacks by the Taliban and al-Qaeda has altered the face of Kunduz beyond all recognition.

properties.headline: Afghan toll 'will rise further'
properties.summary: A British soldier has become the seventh to die in a week of fighting in Afghanistan, as a minister warned "more lives will be lost".

properties.headline: Many killed in Afghan explosion
properties.summary: At least 25 people, including a number of children, have been killed in an explosion in central Afghanistan, officials say.

properties.headline: Inside the brutal Afghan war zone
properties.summary: The line between life and death has become dangerously thin in Afghanistan's bloody war zone, writes BBC correspondent Ian Pannell, who reports exclusively from the front line where he is embedded with British soldiers.

properties.headline: Third soldier dies in Afghanistan
properties.summary: A third British soldier has been killed in Afghanistan, hours after the deaths of two soldiers in Helmand, the Ministry of Defence has said.

properties.headline: Two more UK deaths in Afghanistan
properties.summary: Two more UK troops have died in separate attacks in Helmand province in Afghanistan, the eighth and ninth soldiers to be killed this month.

properties.headline: Helmand's long and difficult road
properties.summary: The military campaign in Afghanistan has now led to more British deaths than the war in Iraq. BBC defence correspondent Caroline Wyatt looks at the campaign so far.

properties.headline: Kabul struggles to get back on song
properties.summary: In rapidly-changing Kabul, the old musician's quarter Kharabat is still marked by past bloodshed and destruction.

properties.headline: MoD names six fallen UK soldiers
properties.summary: Six soldiers killed in Afghanistan on Friday - three of whom were aged 18 - have been named by defence officials.

properties.headline: Helicopters 'are no magic wand'
properties.summary: Britain's armed forces have more than 500 helicopters, but fewer than 30 are being used in Afghanistan.

properties.headline: Afghan helicopter crash kills six
properties.summary: At least six people have been killed in a helicopter crash in the southern Afghan province of Helmand, Nato says.

properties.headline: Prisoners protest at Afghan jail
properties.summary: Hundreds of prisoners at the US-run Bagram jail in Afghanistan are refusing basic privileges to protest about their basic rights, officials say.

properties.headline: Routing Taliban 'may take time'
properties.summary: The top military commander in the US, Adm Michael Mullen, says he does not know how long it will take for security to improve in Afghanistan.

properties.headline: Afghan blast 'kills at least 11'
properties.summary: At least 11 civilians, including five children, have been killed in a blast in Afghanistan's southern province of Kandahar, officials say.

properties.headline: Soldiers dies in Afghan explosion
properties.summary: A British soldier from 2nd Battalion The Rifles has been killed in an explosion in southern Afghanistan, the Ministry of Defence has said.

properties.headline: Afghan helicopter crash kills 16
properties.summary: A civilian helicopter has crashed in southern Afghanistan, killing at least 16 civilians and injuring five, Nato officials have confirmed.

properties.headline: US names soldier in Taliban video
properties.summary: The US military has identified a man shown on a Taliban video as an American soldier captured in Afghanistan.

properties.headline: US seeks Afghan prison overhaul
properties.summary: A US military review is to recommend an overhaul of the entire Afghan prison and judicial systems, Pentagon officials have confirmed.

properties.headline: RAF pair safe after Afghan crash
properties.summary: Two RAF crew members are being treated in an Afghan hospital after their jet crashed in the south of the country.

properties.headline: Afghan mountaineers make history
properties.summary: Afghan climbers have scaled the highest peak in the country for the first time.

properties.headline: UK soldier killed in Afghanistan
properties.summary: A UK soldier has been killed in a blast in Afghanistan, a spokesperson for the Ministry of Defence has said.

properties.headline: Afghan cities attacked by Taliban
properties.summary: Five Afghan security personnel have died in a series of Taliban strikes in eastern Afghanistan, officials say.

properties.headline: Afghan cities attacked by Taliban
properties.summary: Five Afghan security personnel have died in a series of Taliban strikes in eastern Afghanistan, officials say.

properties.headline: Bomb squad soldier dies in blast
properties.summary: A British bomb disposal expert has been killed while trying to defuse a homemade bomb in southern Afghanistan.

properties.headline: UK soldier dies in Afghanistan
properties.summary: A British soldier has died in an explosion in Afghanistan, the Ministry of Defence has confirmed.

properties.headline: Karzai 'to review foreign forces'
properties.summary: Afghan president Hamid Karzai has said that he will review agreements with foreign forces operating in Afghanistan if he is re-elected.

properties.headline: UK soldier killed in Afghanistan
properties.summary: A soldier from the 40th Regiment Royal Artillery has been killed in an blast in southern Afghanistan, the Ministry of Defence has said.

properties.headline: Suicide bombers hit Afghan city
properties.summary: Taliban militants have tried to carry out multiple suicide attacks on government buildings in the eastern Afghan city of Khost, officials say.

properties.headline: Afghans sceptical about elections
properties.summary: The BBC's Bilal Sarwary takes a bus ride in northern Afghanistan to gauge the mood of the people ahead of the presidential elections in August.

properties.headline: Afghan election hopeful attacked
properties.summary: One of Afghan President Hamid Karzai's running mates in next month's election has survived an assassination attempt, officials say.

properties.headline: Afghanistan 'agrees Taliban deal'
properties.summary: The Afghan government has agreed a truce with Taliban insurgents in the north-western province of Badghis ahead of elections next month, officials say.
